goals.question: What is the frequency of bird strikes per year?
goals.visualization: Line chart of bird strikes per year
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the trend of bird strikes over the years and identify any patterns or anomalies.

goals.question: Which bird species is responsible for the most strikes?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of bird species and their frequency of strikes
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most common bird species involved in bird strikes and prioritize measures to mitigate their impact.

goals.question: What is the distribution of bird strikes by time of day?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of bird strikes by time of day
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the time of day when bird strikes are most likely to occur and take preventive measures accordingly.

goals.question: What is the distribution of bird strikes by aircraft type?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of bird strikes by aircraft type
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which aircraft types are most vulnerable to bird strikes and take appropriate measures to reduce the risk.

goals.question: What is the impact of bird strikes on flight delays?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of bird strikes and flight delays
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the correlation between bird strikes and flight delays and identify potential areas for improvement in airport operations.

code:
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    data['year'] = data['date'].dt.year
    yearly_birdstrikes = data.groupby('year').size().reset_index(name='count')
    
    sns.lineplot(x='year', y='count', data=yearly_birdstrikes)
    
    plt.title('What is the frequency of bird strikes per year?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    species_count = data['Species'].value_counts().head(20)
    sns.barplot(x=species_count.index, y=species_count.values)
    plt.xlabel('Bird Species')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency of Strikes')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('Which bird species is responsible for the most strikes?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    data['hour'] = data['date'].dt.hour
    birdstrikes_by_hour = data.groupby('hour').size().reset_index(name='count')
    
    sns.barplot(x='hour', y='count', data=birdstrikes_by_hour)
    
    plt.title('What is the distribution of bird strikes by time of day?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    aircraft_counts = data['Aircraft_Type'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(aircraft_counts, labels=aircraft_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of bird strikes by aircraft type?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='bird_strikes', y='flight_delays')
    plt.title('What is the impact of bird strikes on flight delays?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
